page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content:
AREA SOUTH OF WESTWOODSIDE
AN AREA OF LOW LYING LAND APPROXIMATELY AT SEA LEVEL. IT IS INTERSECTED ROUGHLY EAST TO WEST BY THE WARPING DRAIN, THE GAINSBOROUGH TO DONCASTER RAILWAY LINE, THE RIVER IDLE AND THE MOTHER DRAIN. THE LAND COVER IS MAINLU ARABLE ON WHICH ROOT AND CEREAL CROPS ARE GROWN ON A MISTUTE OF WARP, SAND AND BLACK LAND. THERE IS GOOD GRAZING LAND ON THE BANKS OF TJE IDLE. CATTLE AND PIG REARING IS ESTABLISHED AT A COUPLE OF FARMS, ANOTHER HAS ITS OWN DAIRY HERD PRODUCING THEIR OWN MILK SUPPLY. THE AREA IS SPARSELY POPULATED; THERE ARE TWO LARGE FARMS, FOUR OR FIVE MEDIUM SIZED FARMS, SEVERAL SMALL HOLDINGS, FARM COTTAGES AND PRIVATE HOMES.
